On 9 Dec 2005 at 13:55, tusc72 wrote:

> Hi, I have a class that loads data from a file in it's constructor. To
> easy test this class, I delegate the loading to a method, initData(). It's
> works well, until I want to play with params:
> 

Overriding a method (or even calling an overridable method) from a 
class' c'tor is a Very Bad Idea.  Here's a good explanation why.

<http://pmd.sourceforge.net/rules/design.html#ConstructorCallsOverridableMethod>

Cheers
GRB
